glsa.title: KDE kjs: URI heap overflow vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: KDE fails to properly validate URIs when handling javascript, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: KDE is a feature-rich graphical desktop environment for Linux and Unix-like Operating Systems. kjs is the javascript interpreter used in Konqueror and other parts of KDE.

description.p: Maksim Orlovich discovered an incorrect bounds check in kjs when handling URIs.

impact.p: By enticing a user to load a specially crafted webpage containing malicious javascript, an attacker could execute arbitrary code with the rights of the user running kjs.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All kdelibs users should upgrade to the latest version:

references.uri: KDE Security Advisory: kjs encodeuri/decodeuri heap overflow vulnerability
